intro: Clypeola monosperma, commonly known as the single-seeded clypeola, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces a single, elongated seed enclosed in a tough, woody capsule. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow. Clypeola monosperma is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
